# CKA Buddy UI Redesign Plan

## Context

The current 5-panel layout (Progress, Objective, Run/Next+Terminal side-by-side, Success Card, Command Footer) creates visual overload. Everything competes for attention at once. The goal is a 3-zone layout that feels like an AI coding agent — a focused content feed with a shell-style command bar at the bottom, à la FreecodeChamp × Khan Academy × LLM TUI.

**User choices confirmed:**
- Suggested commands: numbered list in the main feed ([1] cmd, [2] cmd...) with Tab cycling through them
- Navigation: j/k and arrows stay as step navigation; terminal auto-scrolls to bottom

---

## Files Changed

| File | Change |
|------|--------|
| `src/ui/layout.rs` | Complete rewrite of `draw()` — 5-panel → 3-zone |
| `src/app/mod.rs` | Add `hint_message` + `tab_index` state; update draw() call; fix Tab cycling |
| `src/app/state.rs` | Remove unused `VerifyMode` enum |

**Files NOT changed:** engine.rs, content/, progress/, coach/, verify/, terminal/

---

## New Layout

```
┌──────────────────────────────────────────┐  <- 2 lines, no border (styled bg)
│ CKA Buddy  ████░░░ 45%  │ Step 5/20 │ Exam │ Hard │
│ Deploy nginx Pod in default namespace    │
├──────────────────────────────────────────┤  <- Min(0), one scrollable area
│                                          │
│  Deploy an nginx Pod in default ns...   │  <- objective (bold)
│  10 min · Hard · Workloads, RBAC        │  <- metadata (dim)
│                                          │
│  Steps to run:                           │
│  [1] kubectl create namespace test      │  <- cyan/yellow
│  [2] kubectl run nginx --image=nginx    │
│                                          │
│  ─── Terminal ────────────────────────  │  <- dim separator
│  $ kubectl create namespace test        │  <- shell output (gray)
│  namespace/test created                 │
│  $ kubectl run nginx --image=nginx      │
│  pod/nginx created                      │
│                                          │
│  ✓ Deploy nginx complete!               │  <- green (inline success)
│    Pod running in default namespace     │
│                                          │
│  [h] hint  [v] verify  [j/k] nav  [TAB] suggest  │
├──────────────────────────────────────────┤  <- 3 lines
│  step 6/20 unlocked                     │  <- status (dim), or empty
│  ❯ _                                    │  <- command input
└──────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

---

## Implementation Steps

### Step 1 — `src/app/state.rs`

Remove `VerifyMode` enum (never rendered, only passed around). Keep `CompletionCard` unchanged.

### Step 2 — `src/app/mod.rs`

**Add two new local state variables in `run_loop`:**
```rust
let mut hint_message: Option<String> = None;
let mut tab_index: usize = 0;
```

**Update key handlers:**
- `h` key: `hint_message = Some(coach.hint(current_step, &output_log))`
- `j`/`k`/`↑`/`↓`/`b`/`r` navigation: clear `hint_message = None`, `completion_card = None`, `tab_index = 0`
- `Tab` key: cycle through `run_commands` instead of always index 0:
  ```rust
  let cmds = &engine.current_step().run_commands;
  if !cmds.is_empty() {
      command_input = cmds[tab_index % cmds.len()].clone();
      tab_index += 1;
  }
  ```
- Remove `verify_mode` variable (was unused in rendering)

**Update `draw()` call:**
```rust
draw(frame, &engine, &command_input, &status, &output_log,
     hint_message.as_deref(), completion_card.as_ref());
```

### Step 3 — `src/ui/layout.rs`

**New `draw()` signature:**
```rust
pub fn draw(
    frame: &mut Frame,
    engine: &Engine,
    command_input: &str,
    status: &str,
    output_log: &[String],
    hint_message: Option<&str>,
    completion_card: Option<&CompletionCard>,
)
```

**3-zone vertical layout:**
```rust
let zones = Layout::vertical([
    Constraint::Length(2),   // zones[0]: header
    Constraint::Min(0),      // zones[1]: main content
    Constraint::Length(3),   // zones[2]: command bar
]).split(frame.area());
```

**Zone 0 — Header (no border, styled background):**
- Line 1: `" CKA Buddy  [████░░░] 45%  │  Step 5 / 20  │  Exam  │  Hard"`
  - "CKA Buddy" in bold White
  - progress bar built from `█` (filled) and `░` (empty) chars proportional to readiness
  - step info in Cyan
- Line 2: `"  {step.title}"` in bold White
- Render as `Paragraph` with `Style::default().bg(Color::Black)` (or DarkGray)

**Zone 1 — Main content area:**

Build a `Vec<Line>` in order:

1. One blank line
2. Objective text (bold, wrapped) — use `step.objective`
3. Metadata line: `"  {timebox} min · {difficulty} · {domains}"` — dimmed
4. One blank line
5. If `!run_commands.is_empty()`: label `"  Steps to run:"` in dim White
6. For each command in `run_commands`: `"  [{n}] {cmd}"` — `[n]` in DarkGray, cmd in Yellow
7. One blank line
8. Divider line: `"  ─── Terminal " + "─".repeat(remainder)` in DarkGray
9. Terminal output lines (last N that fit, from `output_log`) — Gray
10. If `hint_message.is_some()`: blank line + `"  ● Hint: {text}"` in Yellow italic
11. If `completion_card.is_some()`: blank line + `"  ✓ {card.done}"` in bold Green, then `"    {what_changed}"` lines in Green
12. One blank line
13. Key hints: `"  [h] hint  [v] verify  [j/k] nav  [r] next  [b] back  [TAB] suggest"` in DarkGray

For terminal output scroll: calculate `total_lines` in the built Vec, compare to `zones[1].height`. Use `Paragraph::scroll((offset, 0))` where offset ensures the bottom is visible:
```rust
let scroll = total_lines.saturating_sub(zones[1].height as usize) as u16;
```

Render as: `Paragraph::new(Text::from(lines)).block(Block::default().borders(Borders::NONE)).scroll((scroll, 0))`

**Zone 2 — Command bar:**
- Line 1: status message in DarkGray (or empty space)
- Line 2: `"  ❯ {command_input}"` — `❯` in Cyan, input in White
- Render with top border only: `Block::default().borders(Borders::TOP)`

---

## Styling Reference

| Element | Color / Style |
|---------|---------------|
| Header background | `Color::Black` bg |
| "CKA Buddy" | Bold White |
| Progress bar `█` | Green |
| Progress bar `░` | DarkGray |
| Step position / type | Cyan |
| Step title (header L2) | Bold White |
| Objective text | Bold White |
| Metadata line | DarkGray |
| "Steps to run:" label | DarkGray |
| `[n]` index | DarkGray |
| Suggested command | Yellow |
| Terminal divider | DarkGray |
| Terminal output | Gray |
| Hint bullet `●` | Yellow |
| Hint text | Yellow italic |
| Success `✓` + done | Bold Green |
| what_changed bullets | Green |
| Key hints bar | DarkGray |
| Command bar border | DarkGray |
| `❯` prompt | Cyan |
| Command input | White |
| Status line | DarkGray |

---

## Verification

1. `cargo build` — confirm no compile errors
2. `cargo run` — launch and visually confirm:
   - 3-zone layout renders correctly (no 5-panel)
   - Header shows readiness bar + step title
   - Numbered commands appear in feed
   - Terminal output appears below separator
   - Tab cycles through commands (not always #1)
   - `h` shows hint inline, not in a separate panel
   - `v` pass shows success card inline
   - `j`/`k` navigates steps and clears hint/success
   - Command bar shows `❯` prompt with input
3. Resize terminal window — confirm layout scales gracefully

questions.question: Which creative elements from rebels-in-the-sky are most important to bring to cka-buddy?

options.label: All of the below (Recommended)
options.description: Full visual overhaul — splash screen, widget system, colors, animations, popups, hover system

options.label: Splash screen + ASCII art
options.description: Branded launch screen with ASCII title, Kubernetes-themed quotes, animated elements

options.label: Rich widget system
options.description: Interactive buttons with hover/disabled states, clickable lists/tables, popup modals

options.label: Visual polish only
options.description: Better color palette, progress bars, big numbers for readiness %, box-drawing borders — no new interactivity

options.label: Both (Recommended)

options.label: Slash commands only
options.description: Keep current slash-command-only UX, just make it prettier

options.label: Hotkeys only
options.description: Drop the command bar for navigation, use hotkeys everywhere (slash still for shell commands)

options.label: Full refactor (Recommended)
options.description: Introduce Screen trait, separate panel modules, callback/hover system — cleaner long-term but bigger change

options.label: Incremental enhancement
options.description: Keep layout.rs as the main renderer, add widgets/helpers as separate modules — faster to ship

# CKA-Buddy TUI Redesign — Rebels-in-the-Sky Quality

## Context
The current CKA-Buddy TUI is functional but clinical: a single 488-line `layout.rs` with ~8 basic colors, no splash screen, no popups, no animations. The rebels-in-the-sky project (same Ratatui 0.29 stack) shows what's achievable: rich panels, ASCII art, animated elements, popup modals, hover text, and a professional widget system. This redesign brings CKA-Buddy to that level of polish for an engaging educational experience.

## Approach
Full architectural refactor using rebels-in-the-sky patterns adapted for CKA-Buddy's educational context. Decompose the monolithic renderer into modular screens with a K8s-themed visual overhaul. Keep slash-command-only UX.

## Key Decisions
- **Screen trait system** (from rebels) — `update()`, `render()`, `handle_key_events()` per screen
- **K8s color palette** — 20+ semantic RGB colors (cluster blue, pod green, warning amber, domain-specific)
- **Slash commands preserved** — No mouse/hotkeys added per user preference
- **No new dependencies** — Everything built with existing Ratatui 0.29 + Crossterm 0.28

## New File Structure (11 files replacing 1)
```
src/ui/
    mod.rs              — module declarations
    constants.rs        — K8s color palette (UiStyle struct with const Styles)
    traits.rs           — Screen trait definition
    ui_action.rs        — UiAction enum (navigation, commands, popup control)
    ui_screen.rs        — Top-level screen state machine + popup overlay
    splash_screen.rs    — ASCII art title, DevOps quotes, Start/Continue/Quit menu
    learning_screen.rs  — Main learning interface (replaces layout.rs)
    popup.rs            — StepComplete, Help, VerifyFail, Tutorial popup types
    big_numbers.rs      — ASCII digit font (adapted from rebels)
    button.rs           — Simple button widget for menus
    widgets.rs          — Shared utilities (progress bars, badges, dividers)
```

## 6 Implementation Steps

### 1. Architectural Foundation (`create-foundation`)
Create constants.rs, traits.rs, ui_action.rs, ui_screen.rs. Expand ui/mod.rs. Old layout.rs still works during migration.

### 2. Splash Screen + Buttons (`build-splash`) — depends on #1
ASCII "CKA BUDDY" title in cluster blue, 15 rotating DevOps/K8s quotes, Start/Continue/Quit menu with arrow key navigation, progress summary.

### 3. Learning Screen Visual Overhaul (`build-learning-screen`) — depends on #1, parallel with #2
Migrate layout.rs into LearningScreen. Apply K8s palette: bordered panels, colored badges (step type, difficulty, domains), block-character progress bar. Refactor app/mod.rs event loop to use UiScreen. Create widgets.rs. Delete layout.rs.

### 4. Popup System + Big Numbers (`build-widgets`) — depends on #3
Big-number ASCII readiness display. Centered modal popups: StepComplete (celebration with readiness delta), Help (command reference), VerifyFail, Tutorial. Wire into verify flow and /help command.

### 5. Contextual Help + Tutorial (`build-help-tutorial`) — depends on #4
State-driven footer help bar. 3-page first-launch tutorial. Polish pass on colors and layout.

### 6. Final Validation (`validate-all`) — depends on all above
cargo build, cargo clippy, verify file structure, verify all slash commands work, verify popups render correctly.

## Full Plan
See `specs/tui-redesign-rebels-quality.md` for complete implementation details including:
- Exact color palette definitions with RGB values
- Code examples for all new structs/traits
- Detailed rendering layout diagrams
- Team orchestration with 5 agents
- Acceptance criteria checklist
- Validation commands

## Verification
- `cargo build` — compiles cleanly
- `cargo clippy` — no warnings
- `grep -r "layout::draw" src/` — returns empty (old renderer fully replaced)
- Visual: splash screen shows on launch, learning screen has bordered K8s-themed panels, popups overlay correctly
